results.title: An Unremarkable birth
results.creator_credit: Diane Beaudry, Kathleen Shannon and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A growing number of parents are concerned about the impersonal approach to childbirth seen in many hospitals. They find hospital procedures inflexible and more often geared to the needs of the institution than to those of child and parent. Members of the medical profession and parents discuss today’s obstetric methods and alternatives to them. The film candidly records the birth of a baby and the interaction of mother and father.

results.title: An old box
results.creator_credit: Paul Driessen, Gaston Sarault and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An animated story of a beggar who repairs an old box, in order to set it up and ask for donations. As he stands in the street he gets cold, so he climbs into the box to keep warm. At once a spectacular star descends from the sky to the box and when it returns to the sky, it takes with it the ghost of the beggar. A film without words. (Awards: Chicago; San Franscisco; Melbourne; Dubuque: Los Angeles; Les Menuires.)

results.title: An Occurrence at Owl Creek Bridge
results.creator_credit: Marcel Ichac, Paul de Roubaix, Robert Enrico, Filmartic and Films du Centaure
results.brief_description: A dramatisation of a short story by Ambrose Bierce set during the American Civil War in which a Confederate citizen stands on the scaffold, about to be hanged, and seems, as by a series of miracles, to escape death.

results.title: An Introduction to the defence cataloguing system
results.creator_credit: Yoram Gross, Frank Bagnall, Film Australia and Yoram Gross Films
results.brief_description: Modern warfare involving greater man power and more complex weaponry creates greater problems of supply. Efficient supply management is essential. A common supply language has been devised enabling items to be easily found.

results.title: An Introduction to the art of figure skating
results.creator_credit: Sydney Newman and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The fundamentals of figure skating are demonstrated by world champion Barbara Ann Scott and coach and judge Melville Rogers. A brief discussion of edges and basic figures is followed by an analysis of a number of complex turns. The importance of balance, body, and limbs is explained.

results.title: An Interview with Peter Clemence
results.brief_description: Peter Clemence tells us his experience in the Royal Australian Air Force at the end of the Second World War, his experiences flying scientists in Antarctica in the 1950’s and his adventures flying helicopters during the mining exploration era. He also talks about Ash Wednesday and the collapse of the West Gate Bridge.

results.title: An Interview with May Gibbs
results.brief_description: In 1968 Hazel de Berg interviewed Australia’s most loved storyteller, May Gibbs, the creator of Snugglepot and Cuddlepie and all the bush folk. During the video, you will hear May Gibbs (Mrs. Ossoli Kelly) tell of her birth in 1877 in Surrey, England, her trip to Australia in 1881, her family’s settlement in Western Australia and her adventures in the art schools of London. She speaks of her love of the Australian bush, her development as an artist and reveals the creation of the Gumnuts and all their friends and foes.

results.title: Among fish
results.creator_credit: Kenneth McCready, Rene Jodoin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A demonstration, for junior science classes, of what fish are, how they live, breathe, swim and, more remarkable, how they float up or down by manipulating their air bladder. The fish shown in the film are of the kind native to Canada’s lakes and streams, but others, of the tropical variety, are observed in the miniature marine world of a classroom aquarium. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kenneth McCready, Rene Jodoin and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: American history X (D)
results.creator_credit: Tony Kaye, John Morriseey, New Line Cinema and Turman-Morrissey Company
results.brief_description: Rage vented as racism. Derek Vinyard (Edward Norton) seeks retribution for his father’s murder, and through his distorted logic and his charismatic leadership qualities, commands a growing army of skinheads at Venice Beach, California. Nobody looks up to Derek as much as his younger brother Danny (Edward Furlong), despite the efforts of his mother and teacher to persuade him otherwise. What should have been a case of self-defence, Derek violently attacks and murders an African American attempting to break into his car. After spending 3 years in prison, everyone awaits his return; his gang, his violent girlfriend and his younger brother. But Derek no longer shares the same views he once embraced as a badge of honour. What follows is a race to save his Danny and his family from the violence he’d brought down on so many others. Script by David McKenna.

results.title: An Interview with Gillian Armstrong
results.creator_credit: Sam Mapplebeck, Shelley Matulick and ACMI
results.brief_description:
Award-winning Australian film and documentary director Gillian Armstrong’s film career spans over 40 years locally and internationally.

Here she shares her discovery of Orry-Kelly and the incredibly fortunate set of events that uncovered his memoir and his box of memorabilia including his three Oscars.

The release of Armstrong’s 2015 feature-length documentary on the life and work of renowned costume designer Orry-Kelly, ‘Women He’s Undressed’, coincided with ACMI’s exhibition ‘Orry-Kelly: Dressing Hollywood’.
